intro: Carpesium abrotanoides, commonly known as the yellow cocklebur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its prickly, spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and other open habitats. Due to its aggressive growth, it is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
